perturbation.original_text: 1. Definitions 1.1 The "Equipment Rental Business" or "ERB" has the meaning given to such term in the Distribution Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the definition of 'Equipment Rental Business' (ERB), references to ERB throughout the document become ambiguous. This creates uncertainty, especially in sections detailing the rights and responsibilities related to the ERB trademarks and domains.

perturbation.original_text: 2.12.1 With respect to HSI's worldwide use of the VRB Trademarks incorporating the name/mark HERTZ and HERTZ-formative trademarks and designs and HERC's use of the HERC trademarks (including HERC, HERC360 and other HERC-formative 5 trademarks and designs) in connection with the ERB, the Parties shall cooperate to ensure that no confusion arises in the worldwide marketplace, as more fully set forth in the Coexistence Agreement attached hereto as Exhibit C.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.12.1 With respect to HSI's worldwide use of the VRB Trademarks incorporating the name/mark HERTZ and HERTZ-formative trademarks and designs and HERC's use of the HERC trademarks (including HERC, HERC360 and other HERC-formative 5 trademarks and designs), the Parties shall cooperate to ensure that no confusion arises in the worldwide marketplace, as more fully set forth in the Coexistence Agreement attached hereto as Exhibit C.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'in connection with the ERB', the clause becomes overly broad. It now applies to HERC's use of HERC trademarks *generally*, not specifically in connection with the Equipment Rental Business. Since ERB's definition was removed, this creates an inconsistency because it's unclear if HERC's actions outside the undefined 'Equipment Rental Business' are governed by this clause and the Coexistence Agreement. It is unknown if HERC is subject to the Coexistence Agreement, if the ERB definition is not present.

perturbation.original_text: 8.4 Effect of Termination. Termination of this Agreement shall not result in the termination of any provisions herein which by their nature are meant to survive termination (including any covenants herein related to discontinuation of use of licensed intellectual property and the indemnification provisions hereof), nor shall it relieve any Party of liability for breaches of the terms hereof prior to termination. For the avoidance of doubt, the Parties agree that in the event of termination of this Agreement or the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement, Section 4.4 of the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement contains additional provisions related to termination of licensed intellectual property pursuant to the terms hereof that shall apply as if contained herein.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.4 Effect of Termination. Termination of this Agreement shall not result in the termination of any provisions herein which by their nature are meant to survive termination (including any covenants herein related to discontinuation of use of licensed intellectual property and the indemnification provisions hereof), nor shall it relieve any Party of liability for breaches of the terms hereof prior to termination.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the sentence 'For the avoidance of doubt, the Parties agree that in the event of termination of this Agreement or the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement, Section 4.4 of the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement contains additional provisions related to termination of licensed intellectual property pursuant to the terms hereof that shall apply as if contained herein.', the parties could have contradictory views about what happens, since Section 4.4 of the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement is not present in this agreement. By removing the 'For the avoidance of doubt' clause, there's no clarity regarding Section 4.4, so conflicting interpretation could arrise.
